intro: Heptapleurum biternatum, commonly known as the three-part holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to eastern Asia, particularly China, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy appearance, while its flowers are usually white or pink and appear in spring. The fruit is a small, dark blue berry that develops in the fall.
